          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br>Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<span class="line"><!---->Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<span class="line"><!---->There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<!----></span><br>[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br>[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br><br>Detailed steps<span class="line"><!---->Detailed steps<!----></span><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<span class="line"><!---->3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<!----></span><br>4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<span class="line"><!---->4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<!----></span><br>4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] > EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<span class="line"><!---->4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] &gt; EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<span class="line"><!---->The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <span class="line"><!---->Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <!----></span><br><br>Attached please find the related screen captures. <span class="line"><!---->Attached please find the related screen captures. <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Flash Version: <span class="line"><!---->Flash Version: <!----></span><br><br>This is the extended issue from <span class="line"><!---->This is the extended issue from <!----></span>Issue 1108714<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108714" title="Security: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection UI Discrepancy"><!---->Issue 1108714<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi raymes@<span class="line"><!---->Hi raymes@<!----></span><br><br>FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <span class="line"><!---->FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <!----></span><br><br>1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <span class="line"><!---->1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <!----></span><br><br>2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <span class="line"><!---->2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your attention.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your attention.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<span class="line"><!---->Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<!----></span><br><br>Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<span class="line"><!---->Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<!----></span><br>Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<span class="line"><!---->Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<!----></span><br><br>I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<span class="line"><!---->I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Most probably that change was done in this CL:<span class="line"><!---->Most probably that change was done in this CL:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/1825120<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/1825120"><!---->crrev.com/c/1825120<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <span class="line"><!----> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<!----></a><br><br>>> CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is >> not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is &gt;&gt; not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<!----></span><br><br>>> We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<!----></span><br><br>So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -> fallbacking to "default -> fallbacking to "do not check".<span class="line"><!---->So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -&gt; fallbacking to "default -&gt; fallbacking to "do not check".<!----></span><br><br>Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<span class="line"><!---->Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        }

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1145024: Security&UI: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection "Default" UI Discrepancy
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      hugoh...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->hugoh...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br>Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<span class="line"><!---->Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<span class="line"><!---->There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<!----></span><br>[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br>[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br><br>Detailed steps<span class="line"><!---->Detailed steps<!----></span><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<span class="line"><!---->3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<!----></span><br>4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<span class="line"><!---->4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<!----></span><br>4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] > EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<span class="line"><!---->4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] &gt; EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<span class="line"><!---->The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <span class="line"><!---->Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <!----></span><br><br>Attached please find the related screen captures. <span class="line"><!---->Attached please find the related screen captures. <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Flash Version: <span class="line"><!---->Flash Version: <!----></span><br><br>This is the extended issue from <span class="line"><!---->This is the extended issue from <!----></span>Issue 1108714<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108714" title="Security: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection UI Discrepancy"><!---->Issue 1108714<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi raymes@<span class="line"><!---->Hi raymes@<!----></span><br><br>FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <span class="line"><!---->FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <!----></span><br><br>1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <span class="line"><!---->1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <!----></span><br><br>2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <span class="line"><!---->2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your attention.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your attention.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<span class="line"><!---->Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<!----></span><br><br>Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<span class="line"><!---->Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<!----></span><br>Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<span class="line"><!---->Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<!----></span><br><br>I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<span class="line"><!---->I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1145024#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1145024#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 3, 2021, 6:40 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        Most probably that change was done in this CL:<span class="line"><!---->Most probably that change was done in this CL:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/1825120<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/1825120"><!---->crrev.com/c/1825120<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <span class="line"><!----> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<!----></a><br><br>>> CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is >> not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is &gt;&gt; not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<!----></span><br><br>>> We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<!----></span><br><br>So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -> fallbacking to "default -> fallbacking to "do not check".<span class="line"><!---->So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -&gt; fallbacking to "default -&gt; fallbacking to "do not check".<!----></span><br><br>Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<span class="line"><!---->Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 18<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1145024#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

Please contact milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Your change meets the bar and is auto-approved for M90. Please go ahead and merge the CL to branch 4430 (refs/branch-heads/4430) manually. Please contact milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Merge instructions: <span class="line"><!---->Merge instructions: <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/drover<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/drover"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/drover<!----></a><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

the<!----></span><br>server's CA certificate.<span class="line"><!---->server's CA certificate.<!----></span><br><br>This CL changes the default behavior to use the system CAs as trust anchors.<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

            Issue 1145024: Security&UI: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection "Default" UI Discrepancy
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1145024: Security&amp;UI: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection "Default" UI Discrepancy
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      hugoh...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/506103286" title="hugoh...@gmail.com"><!---->hugoh...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      hugoh...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->hugoh...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Nov 3, 2020, 12:44 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 3, 2020, 12:44 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Nov 3, 2020, 12:44 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br>Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<span class="line"><!---->Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<span class="line"><!---->There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<!----></span><br>[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br>[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br><br>Detailed steps<span class="line"><!---->Detailed steps<!----></span><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<span class="line"><!---->3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<!----></span><br>4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<span class="line"><!---->4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<!----></span><br>4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] > EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<span class="line"><!---->4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] &gt; EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<span class="line"><!---->The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <span class="line"><!---->Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <!----></span><br><br>Attached please find the related screen captures. <span class="line"><!---->Attached please find the related screen captures. <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Flash Version: <span class="line"><!---->Flash Version: <!----></span><br><br>This is the extended issue from <span class="line"><!---->This is the extended issue from <!----></span>Issue 1108714<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108714" title="Security: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection UI Discrepancy"><!---->Issue 1108714<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi raymes@<span class="line"><!---->Hi raymes@<!----></span><br><br>FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <span class="line"><!---->FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <!----></span><br><br>1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <span class="line"><!---->1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <!----></span><br><br>2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <span class="line"><!---->2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your attention.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your attention.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          (was: Assigned)
          <br>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<span class="line"><!---->Agree that "do not check" is a *bad* default and we should never be proposing that in the UI - will work on reproing and fixing that.<!----></span><br><br>Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<span class="line"><!---->Arguably "Server CA certificate" = "Default" is also a bad choice for most deployments because it means that the remote authentication server could be run by anyone who gets a certificate from any of the publicly trusted CAs.<!----></span><br>Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<span class="line"><!---->Is the deployment we're talking about actually using "Default" here?<!----></span><br><br>I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<span class="line"><!---->I think that longer term, the best behavior here would be to not pre-select any default and require an explicit user choice before allowing to connect, explaining the options better in the UI (the current "Default" doesn't really say anything IMO).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Most probably that change was done in this CL:<span class="line"><!---->Most probably that change was done in this CL:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/1825120<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/1825120"><!---->crrev.com/c/1825120<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <span class="line"><!----> I found a comment from stevenjb@ explaining the logic behind the default selection (quoted in the next lines): <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1825120/2..5/ui/webui/resources/cr_components/chromeos/network/network_config.js#b1171<!----></a><br><br>>> CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is >> not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; CA certificates can be set to 3 types of values: 'do not check the certificate', 'use the default system certificate authorities', and 'use a specific certificate authority'. The 'use default' option is &gt;&gt; not always available. So there will always be 1 ('do not check'), and may be more ('use default' followed by actual certificates, followed by 'do not check').<!----></span><br><br>>> We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; We want the default to be an installed certificate if it exists, or 'do not check' otherwise.<!----></span><br><br>So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -> fallbacking to "default -> fallbacking to "do not check".<span class="line"><!---->So I will upload a CL that changes the default behavior to address this bug concern. The new behavior will be "The default should be an installed certificate if exists" -&gt; fallbacking to "default -&gt; fallbacking to "do not check".<!----></span><br><br>Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<span class="line"><!---->Please tell me if there is smth I misunderstood.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by hugoh...@gmail.com (Nov 3, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hugoh...@gmail.com (Nov 3, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hugoh...@gmail.com (Nov 3, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hugoh...@gmail.com (Nov 3, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.99 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br>Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<span class="line"><!---->Platform: 13020.73.2020_07_02_1544 (Developer Build - vanilla) developer-build amd64-vanilla<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<span class="line"><!---->There are mainly 2 ways to reproduce the issue.<!----></span><br>[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[1]: clicking the Wi-Fi from the scanned list from "Settings" or the panel in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br>[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<span class="line"><!---->[2]: creating a new Wi-Fi network profile from "Settings" or by clicking the add Wi-Fi button in the bottom-right corner<!----></span><br><br>Detailed steps<span class="line"><!---->Detailed steps<!----></span><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<span class="line"><!---->3. Select a Wi-Fi network (in WPA-Enterprise) from the scanned list<!----></span><br>4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<span class="line"><!---->4. Choose [PEAP/EAP-TTLS] for "EAP method"<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Default" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->1. Click out the panel in the bottom-right corner/Go the "Settings"<!----></span><br>2. Switch on Wi-Fi<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch on Wi-Fi<!----></span><br>3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<span class="line"><!---->3. Click the icon of "logo of add Wi-Fi" (Join other Wi-Fi networks) in the panel/Click "Add connection", then "Add Wi-Fi..." in "Settings"<!----></span><br>4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] > EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<span class="line"><!---->4. Input as follows, SSID [ANY], Security [EAP] &gt; EAP method [PEAP/EAP-TTLS], EAP Phase-2 authentication [ANY]<!----></span><br>5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<span class="line"><!---->5. Then the default setting of "Do not check" will be shown in the field of "Server CA certificate"<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<span class="line"><!---->The same default setting is expected for "Server CA certificate" from two different entry points.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <span class="line"><!---->Such a UI discrepancy would not only confuse the users to configure a secure network setup for WPA Enterprise network, but also perplex the IT admin to instruct the users to setup the PEAP/EAP-TTLS connection if the default settings are different from two different entry points. It is suggested to set "Default" (Perform server certificate validation with System CAs as the trust anchor) for the field of "Server CA certificate", by default. If the users are trapped to use the default setting by creating a new Wi-Fi network in the current setting, the connection could be compromised to "Evil-Twin Attack" due to the lack of checking the server certificate. <!----></span><br><br>Attached please find the related screen captures. <span class="line"><!---->Attached please find the related screen captures. <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 86.0.4240.99  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: Version 83.0.4103.99 (Official Build)  (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Flash Version: <span class="line"><!---->Flash Version: <!----></span><br><br>This is the extended issue from <span class="line"><!---->This is the extended issue from <!----></span>Issue 1108714<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108714" title="Security: WPA2-Enterprise/EAP WiFi Connection UI Discrepancy"><!---->Issue 1108714<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Hi raymes@<span class="line"><!---->Hi raymes@<!----></span><br><br>FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <span class="line"><!---->FYR, the (default) configuration applies to any devices using/connecting to a WPA2/3 Enterprise wireless network, e.g. Eduroam. The reasons why the default settings were insecure are that <!----></span><br><br>1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <span class="line"><!---->1. Two entry points to the setting raise two different default settings. This would lead the technicians being confused to instruct the end-users. <!----></span><br><br>2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <span class="line"><!---->2. One of the default settings is by default "Do not check" the server certificate. Such a configuration is not compliant with the TLS-based protocol, PEAP/EAP-TTLS, which exposes the end-users into the treat of connecting to a rogue AP. <!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your attention.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your attention.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
